snippet: News that militants in Belgium had planned to strike in France was a reminder that much is still unknown about the Islamic State’s networks in Europe.
abstract: Revelations that Islamic State originally planned to attack Paris again before Brussels attacks in March spreads fear that terrorists could launch attacks at any moment in other European capitals; many experts see extremist group as deadly, and mostly hidden, peril across much of Europe, with long road ahead to contain it.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Brussels, and Eric Schmitt from London and Naples, Italy. Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris, and C.J. Chivers from the United States.

lead_paragraph: News that militants in Belgium had planned to strike in France was a reminder that much is still unknown about the Islamic State’s networks in Europe.

headline.main: Revelation on Brussels Attackers Fuels Fears of New Assaults
headline.print_headline: A New Paris Plot Before Brussels Spreads Concern

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
